channel.title: awesome-course on lunarwhite
channel.description: Recent content in awesome-course on lunarwhite

item.title: [MIT-missing] 07 Potpourri, Q&A
item.description: Potpourri - missing-semester Q&A - missing-semester 1 Daemons Most computers have a series of processes that are always running in the background rather than waiting for a user to launch them and interact with them.

item.title: [MIT-missing] 06 Security & Cryptography
item.description: Security and Cryptography - missing-semester 1 Entropy Entropy is a measure of randomness. This is useful, for example, when determining the strength of a password.

item.title: [MIT-missing] 05 Metaprogramming
item.description: Metaprogramming - missing-semester 1 build systems make is one of the most common build systems out there. When you run make, it consults a file called Makefile in the current directory.

item.title: [MIT-missing] 04 Version Control (Git)
item.description: Version Control (Git) - missing-semester 1 git’s data model 1.1 snapshots Git models the history of a collection of files and folders within some top-level directory as a series of snapshots.

item.title: [MIT-missing] 03 Command-line Environment
item.description: Command-line Environment - missing-semester 1 Job Control To kill a process, type Ctrl-C. To pause and backgrounding processes, type Ctrl-Z.

item.title: [MIT-missing] 02 Data Wrangling
item.description: Data Wrangling - missing-semester 1 introduction To wrangle data, we need two things: data to wrangle, and something to do with it.

item.title: [MIT-missing] 01 The shell
item.description: Course overview + the shell - missing-semester Shell Tools and Scripting - missing-semester 01 - intro some commands 1.
